comment.text: This translation key is used to display the label for a Microsoft sign-up button. It appears on the login form and is translated to support different languages, ensuring a consistent user experience across various regions.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The Bulgarian translation "Влезте чрез Microsoft" translates to "Log in with Microsoft". The English phrase "Sign up with Microsoft" means to create a new account using Microsoft, not just to log in.
The translation 'Rekisteröidy Microsoftilla' is not the most natural or idiomatic way to say 'Sign up with Microsoft' in Finnish. While technically correct, it sounds slightly awkward.

The translation "Գրանցվեք Microsoft-ով" while technically conveying 'Sign up with Microsoft', can be improved for naturalness and clarity in Armenian. The '-ով' suffix implies 'with' as in 'using' which isn't always the best fit. A more common and natural translation would be something closer to 'Հաշվեգրություն ստեղծեք Microsoft-ի միջոցով' (Hashvegrit stեղdzek Microsoft-i mijocov) or similar.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Հաշվեգրություն ստեղծեք Microsoft-ի միջոցով (Hashvegrit stեղdzek Microsoft-i mijocov) or Գրանցվել Microsoft-ով (Grancvel Microsoft-ov)

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The Lao translation "ເຂົ້າສູ່ລະບົບດ້ວຍ Microsoft" translates to "Log in with Microsoft", not "Sign up with Microsoft". While related, the nuance is different. 'Sign up' implies creating a new account.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: ລົງທະບຽນດ້ວຍ Microsoft

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The translation 'Inscreva-se na Microsoft' is technically correct but doesn't convey the intended meaning as clearly as it could. 'Sign up with' implies creating an account *using* Microsoft, not simply subscribing to Microsoft.
The translation 'Cadastre-se com Linkedin' incorrectly translates 'Sign up with Microsoft'. It substitutes 'Microsoft' with 'Linkedin'.

'Conectare prin Microsoft' translates to 'Connect with Microsoft,' which isn't quite as accurate as 'Sign up with Microsoft'. While 'connect' is related, 'sign up' is the more precise action being requested.

The translation "Vpiši se z Microsoft" is a literal translation and doesn't sound natural in Slovenian. The more idiomatic translation would be "Prijava z Microsoftom" or "Registracija z Microsoftom".
The translation "Региструј се путем Microsoft-а" is a literal translation that doesn't flow naturally in Serbian. "Putem" is a bit clunky in this context.

The possessive case ending '-а' on 'Microsoft-а' can be improved. Using the preposition 'са' (with) makes the phrasing more natural and aligns better with common Serbian usage for this type of action.

The Serbian translation "Registruj se putem Microsoft-a" is not the most natural or accurate translation of "Sign up with Microsoft." While technically correct, it's a bit clunky. A more natural phrasing would be something like "Prijavi se sa Microsoft-om" or "Kreiraj nalog sa Microsoft-om".

The translation '用 Microsoft 帐号注册' while conveying a similar meaning, is not a direct translation of 'Sign up with Microsoft'. A more literal and closer translation would be '使用 Microsoft 注册' or '用 Microsoft 注册'.
